Room.Name: On the spider web
Room.Description: You are balancing carefully on the giant sticky threads that holds the giant web in place. To the south leads a strand to a cave-like structure made from many layers of a spider web. Another silky strand continues to the north.

ExtraDescription.Description: The immense spider web moves softly.

Room.Name: On the spider web
Room.Description: You are balancing carefully on the giant sticky threads that holds the giant web in place. To the north leads a strand to a cave-like structure made from many layers of a spider web.

ExtraDescription.Description: The immense spider web moves softly.

Room.Name: On the spider web
Room.Description: You are balancing carefully on the giant sticky threads that holds the giant web in place. To the east leads a strand to a cave-like structure made from many layers of a spider web.

ExtraDescription.Description: The immense spider web moves softly.

Room.Name: On the spider web
Room.Description: You are balancing carefully on the giant sticky threads that holds the giant web in place. A single silky strand lead to the south, while another leads off into the northern direction.

ExtraDescription.Description: The immense spider web moves softly.

Room.Name: Webbed Entrance
Room.Description: Sticky, sticky, sticky! The ground is cluttered with leaves, decayed remains of webbed crickets, beetle, rats, dogs (?), and even humans. You begin to wonder about what lies ahead. The air is damp here, and even the little light that shines through the canopy seems absorbed into the webbing.

Room.Name: Webby Passage
Room.Description: You find that footing here is very good, almost too good. The limbs are coated with cobwebs and seem unusually strong for tree branches. Paths lead in four directions. The eastward path goes down a bit.

Room.Name: Wasp Hive
Room.Description: Drones scuttle about in this room. The cells on the walls are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see have fang-marks on there bodies. You sense some order in their markings.

Room.Name: Webby Passage
Room.Description: Another webby passage, all sticky and wet. Tiny ballooning spiders fill the air. It seems that these young ones are newborns.

Room.Name: Beneath the Busy Path
Room.Description: You hear the sounds of crawling arachnids above. The rhythms of the footsteps suggest a primitive order in their movement. The light seems brighter upwards.

Room.Name: On the Busy Path
Room.Description: Spiders, spiders, everywhere! It is almost ant-like in efficiency with one big difference. The spiders here are carrying ant-corpses, as well as rats, wolves, and humans.

Room.Name: On the Busy Path
Room.Description: Spiders, spiders, everywhere! It is almost ant-like in efficiency with one big difference. The spiders here are carrying ant-corpses, as well as cats, wolves, and humans.

Room.Name: On the Busy Path
Room.Description: Spiders, spiders, everywhere! It is almost ant-like in efficiency with one big difference. The spiders here are carrying ant-corpses, as well as cats, dogs, and humans.

Room.Name: A Split in the Path
Room.Description: As always, there is a split in the road. One road is strewn with cricket feelers. The other is well-kept and suitable for smooth travelling. The webbing that was prevalent in earlier rooms is almost non-existent now.

Room.Name: Fuzzy Tree Limb
Room.Description: You are on a "fuzzy" tree limb. Interesting, since the branches seem to have "hairs" sprouting from its bark. As you look closer you see millions of aphids covering each limb.

Room.Name: Tree Trunk
Room.Description: You feel that you can rest here safely. There is evidence of webbing here, but it is of a finer quality.

Room.Name: Tree Lair Entrance
Room.Description: It seems the inhabitant of this place does not web her victims, as evidenced by the remains before you. The area is cluttered with desiccated corpses, apparently bitten but unwebbed, and drained of their life juices.

Room.Name: Wolf Spider Lair
Room.Description: Very dark, as all lairs of spiders are. Not much of furnishings save an exit. The wolf spider keeps no corpses here, but rather throws them out at her leisure.

Room.Name: The Webless Path
Room.Description: Strange. No webbing here. In fact, no sounds whatsoever. The path continues northward, where you find that you may have to tightrope your way across a ravine.

Room.Name: Above the Ravine
Room.Description: Stranger still. Your feet get a real firm grip on the spiderline. You are above a deep ravine. This line connects you between two trees. Below you can see a prismatic web with lots of animal bones caught in it: some bear and small deer bones in fact. No human skeletons are visible (yet).

Room.Name: The Rainbow Web
Room.Description: This is the rainbow web--each strand, each link, a hue of violently sharp colors and contrasts. The resident here seems to have a command of light as well.

Room.Name: The Web Forest
Room.Description: The trees here take on a different appearance--they are not trees anymore, but disjointed make-shift silken made shafts, sticky to the touch, and webby in texture. This is another world it would appear.

Room.Name: The Slave Pit
Room.Description: You have entered the slave pit. A voice blares in the distance, "Get back to work, maggots!" Rails upon rails of mined gold and silver clutter the trail beneath you.

Room.Name: The Tether Path
Room.Description: Another tether path just like the rest of them. Surprisingly well -lit by the golden orbs that hang from the sides, you can see the paths become finer and finer in quality.

Room.Name: A Road Crossing
Room.Description: Another shifty little strand of webs, almost ethereal in nature.

Room.Name: A Leader Strand
Room.Description: This strand is weightier, more sturdy. It shimmers as you step on it. You are definitely not in the Midgaardian realms anymore. Just where you are you can't tell. It feels like you're moving through ether. You can still get back down to more surer lands.

Room.Name: The Entrance of the Ethereal Web
Room.Description: You are at the entrance to ethereal web. Flickering in and out, in and out, each strand reveals a different hue from black to green to blue.

Room.Name: A Narrow Series of Caves
Room.Description: Here is a filthy section of narrow and stinking caves. Maggots of wasps and other baby vermin lie scattered about. The walls are coated with a layer of larvae husks and other scum.

Room.Name: The Base of the Web
Room.Description: Large strands connect at this point. The node shimmers and flickers within the ether. You see many flying creatures-- insects, pegasi, and dragon wormkins--navigate the dangerous passages of the web. Exits go in many directions.

Room.Name: Through the Trees
Room.Description: This part of the web intersects through the branches of some trees. Various leaves and other debris that the many drones have not picked up yet lie here.

Room.Name: Above the Clouds
Room.Description: You can see all of Midgaard in this ethereal web. Many of the larger dragons that do wish to fly seem to fly away from the sticky strands of the web.

Room.Name: On A Cloud
Room.Description: Rather thick in consistency. You realize this is not a typical cloud, but it might be the nest of an aerial creature.

Room.Name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
Room.Description: This is another link in the ethereal web. Various creatures seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands.

Room.Name: The Tenuous Strand
Room.Description: Very windy here since it goes up into the sky somewhat. Still, it's safe enough to move around.

Room.Name: The Elder Wormkin's Room
Room.Description: A more mature wormkin it seems resides here. Various tomes of arcane lore clutter the area, along with shards of armor and weaponry.

Room.Name: Another Tree Limb
Room.Description: Once again the web crosses another tree limb. To the side you see the possible entrance to another creatures lair.

Room.Name: The Bird Spider's Lair
Room.Description: This is a big game hunter among most spiders. Crush jewels and other weapons suggest the inhabitant must have powerful jaws. Beware!

Room.Name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
Room.Description: This is another link in the ethereal web. Various creatures seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands.

Room.Name: The Quiet Tree Top
Room.Description: Here is a quiet tree top.

Room.Name: On The Web
Room.Description: RRRRRRRRRRROOOOOOOOOOOOOAAAAAAAAAAAAAARR! You hear the roar of a powerful beast. Dragon, you think. You shiver in your boots as you tiptoe on this section of the web.

Room.Name: The Ki-Rin Chamber
Room.Description: A wise ki-rin was entrapped here many years ago. It is from her that the ruler of this realm steals his magical strength.

Room.Name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
Room.Description: This is another link in the ethereal web. Various creatures seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands. To the north you sense the heavy breathing of a fiery animal.

Room.Name: Yevaud's Lair
Room.Description: Yevaud, the Usurper of Midgaard, resides here. A voice cries out, "BEWARE, the Usurper of Midgaard lives here! FLEE while you can!" But even Yevaud has his master...or so you deduce.

Room.Name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
Room.Description: This is another link in the ethereal web. Various creatures seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands. A single spider line lies to the north, while ghastly seemings are due southward. The grim entrance of Arachnos' Lair is downward.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Donjonkeep
Room.Description: A dark path at the end of the web strand, you see ahead a torch lit chamber where the souls of unavenged adventurers come and gnash their teeth. The howls and screams of many echo through the hall ways. You see one definite path ahead.

Room.Name: The Guardian's Room
Room.Description: A chair sits here for a tireless guardian who ensures that no soul escapes. The room is undecorated.

ExtraDescription.Description: An ordinary chair, well used, glued to the ground by spiderweb.

Room.Name: Realm of the Hopeless
Room.Description: Here you see many misguided souls who think they still live. They search for those who killed them without warrant, and seek the free souls of living beings to inhabit and perhaps adventure once more.

Room.Name: Realm of the Hopeless
Room.Description: Here you see many misguided souls who think they still live. They search for those who killed them without warrant, and seek the free souls of living beings to inhabit and perhaps adventure once more.

Room.Name: The Donjonkeep
Room.Description: No souls have ever lived in this place. The wails of slaves and the howls of wolves are the only way you can describe the sounds you hear. The walls are thin and wispy. The only light you receive is the shimmering from the strand of the ethereal web you used to get here.

Room.Name: The Single Spider Line
Room.Description: A single spider line supports you once more. As you look across the ether you seen a single shack up ahead with a light in the window. You sense a great evil coming from the east and feel inclined to go back on the ethereal web and take your chances there.

Room.Name: The Single Spider Line
Room.Description: A single spider line supports you once more. The shack comes closer into view and you are even more inclined to go back now.

Room.Name: The Hermit's Corner
Room.Description: Here you see evidence of a vagrant's abode. The shack is to the east, if you dare enter it. You get the sneaking feeling you should go back now. The skies above you darken and roar with the laughter of thunder.

Room.Name: Mahatma's Inescapable Trap
Room.Description: Mahatma, that silly thief, is here, and he steals everything you have. He says, 'Here, have a quick trip to the Temple of Midgaard.' He plunges a black dagger into your back ...

Room.Name: The Entrance to the Arachnos' Lair
Room.Description: All strands inevitably lead here, the center of the web, the entrance to Arachnos' Lair.

Room.Name: The Sticky Chamber
Room.Description: You can still bail out since your knees are shaking from the anticipation (or is it fear?). The sky is clear on this strand of web, surprisingly unsticky. The strand does not vibrate like the others. A few ballooning spiders pass by, cackling "You're gonna die, you're gonna fry. Good bye!"

Room.Name: The Great Door
Room.Description: Before you you see a large, web-like door. Various designs of ancient runes and names of Midgaard heroes are etched into the webwork. Perhaps lists of victims? You can't tell.

Room.Name: The Lair of Arachnos
Room.Description: This is the lair of the Empress Spider, Arachnos. A lavishly adorned rainbow web, her lair allows her to move to any universe she wishes by using her magical strands to the Prime Material Plane. Coffers upon coffers of gold, magical jewels and gems await. Unfor- tunately Arachnos is a baggy spider too, and webs all her treasures to her beautiful silken body.

NPC.name: spider young
NPC.description: He looks freshly hatched and sprightly. His young fangs are just growing in as of late.
NPC.longDescription: The young spider is ballooning by you.

NPC.name: dragon Yevaud
NPC.description: Old, scaly, but still with a lot of bite in him left.
NPC.longDescription: Yevaud the Usurper of Midgaard is here, grinning evilly at you.

NPC.name: spider wolf
NPC.description: The Wolf Spider is hairy, very hairy.
NPC.longDescription: The Wolf Spider is here, licking its bloody fangs.

NPC.name: orc
NPC.description: You notice an evil look in his eyes.
NPC.longDescription: The orc is stuck in the web and he can't get out.

NPC.name: wasp queen
NPC.description: You notice a glazed look in her eyes.
NPC.longDescription: The Queen Wasp is here, thinking that you would make a tasty offering to her master.

NPC.name: spider drone
NPC.longDescription: The drone spider walks around doing her master's bidding.

NPC.name: spider ethereal
NPC.longDescription: The ethereal spider strides here, traveling to different worlds.

NPC.name: slave human
NPC.description: The slave does not mind you, but will fight like a warrior if attacked.

NPC.name: quasit
NPC.description: Demoniac in nature, but more mischievous. He twiddles his thumbs and creates a magical treasure!
NPC.longDescription: The quasit blinks in and out, grinning at you.

NPC.name: spider bird
NPC.description: The Bird Spider has very powerful jaws.
NPC.longDescription: The Bird Spider snaps its powerful jaws.

NPC.name: hermit
NPC.description: A dishevelled veteran warrior in disguise is what he is, but he means well.
NPC.longDescription: The Hermit sits here and warns, "Go back before it's too late!"

NPC.name: donjonkeeper
NPC.description: He delves deeper into you as you stare at him.
NPC.longDescription: The Donjonkeeper eyes you and wonders how pure your soul is.

NPC.name: guardian
NPC.description: He looks like a lazy bum who sleeps half the time.
NPC.longDescription: The guardian is obviously not doing his job.

NPC.name: spider empress arachnos
NPC.description: She is a very attractive spider with an ornate gown. She tempts you into being one of her many slaves. She does not possess the venomous fangs of normal spiders, but then, as you realize, she does not need them.
NPC.longDescription: Arachnos the Empress of Spiders welcomes you with an evil smile.

NPC.name: ki-rin
NPC.description: She is the last bastion of good in this realm. Her mission is to someday free the slaves of the Empress.
NPC.longDescription: The Ki-Rin smiles good-naturedly to you.

NPC.name: dragon wormkin young
NPC.description: Rather small, you almost feel sad in killing it.
NPC.longDescription: A wormkin with no teeth plays here.

NPC.name: dragon wormkin medium
NPC.description: A medium-sized dragon--seems it hasn't killed anything yet by itself.
NPC.longDescription: A wormkin that has grown a bit stares at you inquisitively.

NPC.name: spider poisonous
NPC.description: This disgusting creature is at the size of a human crawling on all four. It has eight hairy legs that gives it a tremendous speed on almost any surface and sharp poisonous fangs to paralyze or kill its prey.
NPC.longDescription: A huge, poisonous spider is here.

NPC.name: queen spider
NPC.description: This disgusting creature is at the size of a small elephant. It has eight huge, hairy legs that would give it a tremendous speed on almost any surface if it wasn't so immensely fat. Its large, bulbous eyes stare back at you.
NPC.longDescription: The huge, bulky Queen Spider is here.

Item.Name: headdress pontiff's
Item.LongDescription: A white cone-shaped head ornament with religious symbols lies here.

Item.Name: coins silver gold
Item.LongDescription: A big pile of coins is lying here.

Item.Name: potion blue
Item.LongDescription: A blue potion has been left here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It has a nice sky blue colour and a smell like peppermint.
